1.text: A wise son is instructed of his father; But a scorner heareth not rebuke.

2.text: A man shall eat good from the fruit of his mouth; But the desire of the faithless is violence.

3.text: He that guardeth his mouth keepeth his life; But for him that openeth wide his lips there shall be ruin.

4.text: The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing; But the soul of the diligent shall be abundantly gratified.

5.text: A righteous man hateth lying; But a wicked man behaveth vilely and shamefully.

6.text: Righteousness guardeth him that is upright in the way; But wickedness overthroweth the sinner.

7.text: There is that pretendeth himself rich, yet hath nothing; There is that pretendeth himself poor, yet hath great wealth.

8.text: The ransom of a man’s life are his riches; But the poor heareth no threatening.

9.text: The light of the righteous rejoiceth; But the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.

10.text: By pride cometh only contention; But with the well-advised is wisdom.

11.text: Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished; But he that gathereth little by little shall increase.

12.text: Hope deferred maketh the heart sick; But desire fulfilled is a tree of life.

13.text: Whoso despiseth the word shall suffer thereby; But he that feareth the commandment shall be rewarded.

14.text: The teaching of the wise is a fountain of life, To depart from the snares of death.

15.text: Good understanding giveth grace; But the way of the faithless is harsh.

16.text: Every prudent man dealeth with forethought; But a fool unfoldeth folly.

17.text: A wicked messenger falleth into evil; But a faithful ambassador is health.

18.text: Poverty and shame shall be to him that refuseth instruction; But he that regardeth reproof shall be honoured.

19.text: The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul; And it is an abomination to fools to depart from evil.

20.text: He that walketh with wise men shall be wise; But the companion of fools shall smart for it.

21.text: Evil pursueth sinners; But to the righteous good shall be repaid.

22.text: A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children’s children; And the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the righteous.

23.text: Much food is in the tillage of the poor; But there is that is swept away by want of righteousness.

24.text: He that spareth his rod hateth his son; But he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.

25.text: The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his desire; But the belly of the wicked shall want.
